verses.text: The LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.comment: God commands Moses concerning vengeance against the Midianites.

verses.text: “Avenge the people of Israel on the Midianites. Afterward, you will be gathered to your people.”
verses.comment: God calls for judgment on the Midianites for leading Israel to sin at Peor.

verses.text: So Moses spoke to the people, saying, “Arm some of yourselves for war, so that they may go against Midian to carry out the LORD’s vengeance on Midian.
verses.comment: Moses relays the LORD's command to the people.

verses.text: You shall send a thousand from each of the tribes of Israel to the war.”
verses.comment: Specific number of warriors from each tribe.

verses.text: So a thousand from each tribe, twelve thousand armed for war, were supplied from the divisions of Israel.
verses.comment: Total number of troops prepared.

verses.text: And Moses sent them to the war, a thousand from each tribe, along with Phinehas the son of Eleazar the priest, with the holy vessels and the trumpets for the alarm in his hand.
verses.comment: Phinehas accompanies the forces as a priestly representative.

verses.text: They fought against Midian, just as the LORD commanded Moses, and they killed every male.
verses.comment: Total destruction of enemy males.

verses.text: They killed the kings of Midian, Evi, Rekem, Zur, Hur, and Reba, the five kings of Midian. They also killed Balaam the son of Beor with the sword.
verses.comment: Balaam’s death ties back to his role in Israel’s seduction (cf. Num 31:16).

verses.text: The people of Israel took captive the women of Midian and their little ones. They took as plunder all their livestock, their herds, and all their goods.
verses.comment: Women and children initially taken captive.

verses.text: They burned all their cities where they lived and all their encampments with fire.
verses.comment: Complete destruction of Midianite settlements.

verses.text: They took all the spoil and all the plunder, both people and animals.
verses.comment: Summary of plunder taken.

verses.text: Then they brought the captives, the plunder, and the spoil to Moses, Eleazar the priest, and the congregation of the people of Israel at the camp on the plains of Moab, by the Jordan at Jericho.
verses.comment: Setting: Plains of Moab near Jericho.

verses.text: Moses, Eleazar the priest, and all the leaders of the congregation went out to meet them outside the camp.
verses.comment: Reception of returning warriors.

verses.text: Moses was angry with the officers of the army, the commanders of thousands and of hundreds, who had come from the battle.
verses.comment: Moses’s anger sets up his rebuke.

verses.text: Moses said to them, “Have you kept all the women alive?
verses.comment: Direct question exposing their failure to fully obey.

verses.text: Look, these women, on Balaam’s advice, caused the people of Israel to act unfaithfully against the LORD in the matter of Peor, so that the plague happened among the congregation of the LORD.
verses.comment: Balaam’s plot is made explicit here.

verses.text: Now therefore, kill every male among the little ones, and kill every woman who has had relations with a man.
verses.comment: Command of total destruction except for virgins; context concerns Midianite role in leading Israel astray.

verses.text: But all the young girls who have not known a man by sleeping with him, keep alive for yourselves.
verses.comment: Only virgin girls are spared.

verses.text: Encamp outside the camp for seven days. Whoever of you has killed any person, and whoever has touched any slain, purify yourselves and your captives on the third and on the seventh day.
verses.comment: Ritual purification for war impurity.

verses.text: You shall purify every garment, every article made of skin, every work of goats’ hair, and every article of wood.”
verses.comment: Purification also required for all items taken as plunder.

verses.text: Then Eleazar the priest said to the men in the army who went to the battle, “This is the statute of the law that the LORD commanded Moses:
verses.comment: Eleazar outlines the law about cleansing metals.

verses.text: Only the gold, the silver, the bronze, the iron, the tin, and the lead,
verses.comment: List of metals requiring purification by fire.

verses.text: everything that can withstand fire, you shall pass through the fire, and it shall be clean. Nevertheless, it shall be purified with the water for impurity. But whatever cannot withstand the fire you shall pass through the water.
verses.comment: All war equipment and items must be ritually purified.

verses.text: You must wash your clothes on the seventh day, and you shall be clean. Afterward you may come into the camp.”
verses.comment: Final step for entering the camp after purification.

verses.text: The LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.comment: God now instructs how to divide the plunder.

verses.text: “Take a count of the plunder that was taken, both of man and animal, you and Eleazar the priest and the chiefs of the fathers’ houses of the congregation,
verses.comment: List and divide the spoils with priestly and lay oversight.

verses.text: and divide the plunder in two, between the warriors who went out to battle and all the congregation.
verses.comment: Spoils split evenly between fighters and the rest of Israel.

verses.text: And levy a tribute for the LORD from the men of war who went out to battle: one life out of five hundred, of both the people and of the cattle and the donkeys and the flocks.
verses.comment: A tax/dedication to the LORD from the warriors’ share.

verses.text: Take it from their half and give it to Eleazar the priest as a contribution to the LORD.
verses.comment: The priests receive the LORD’s tribute.

verses.text: And from the people’s half you shall take one drawn out of every fifty, of the people, of the cattle, of the donkeys, and of the flocks, of all kinds of animals, and give them to the Levites who keep the charge of the LORD’s tabernacle.”
verses.comment: The Levites receive from the congregation’s share.

verses.text: Moses and Eleazar the priest did as the LORD commanded Moses.
verses.comment: Obedience to the divine instructions.

verses.text: Now the plunder remaining from the spoil that the army had taken was 675,000 sheep,
verses.comment: Sheep total.

verses.text: 72,000 cattle,
verses.comment: Cattle total.

verses.text: 61,000 donkeys,
verses.comment: Donkey total.

verses.text: and 32,000 persons in all, women who had not known a man by sleeping with him.
verses.comment: Virgins spared alive make up this number.

verses.text: The half, the share of those who went out to war, was: 337,500 sheep,
verses.comment: First division half for fighters.

verses.text: of which the LORD’s tribute was 675.
verses.comment: Sheep tax for priests.

verses.text: The cattle were 36,000, of which the LORD’s tribute was 72.
verses.comment: Cattle tax.

verses.text: The donkeys were 30,500, of which the LORD’s tribute was 61.
verses.comment: Donkey tax.

verses.text: The people were 16,000, of whom the LORD’s tribute was 32 persons.
verses.comment: 32 young women given as tribute to the LORD, likely for service at the sanctuary.

verses.text: Moses gave the tribute, the contribution for the LORD, to Eleazar the priest, as the LORD commanded Moses.
verses.comment: Obedience to the divide of tribute.

verses.text: From the people of Israel’s half, which Moses separated from that of the men who had gone to war—
verses.comment: Now the other half is for the rest.

verses.text: now the congregation’s half was 337,500 sheep,
verses.comment: Congregation’s share.

verses.text: 36,000 cattle,
verses.comment: Cattle.

verses.text: 30,500 donkeys,
verses.comment: Donkeys.

verses.text: and 16,000 persons.
verses.comment: Young women.

verses.text: From the people of Israel’s half, Moses took one out of every fifty, both of man and of animal, and gave them to the Levites, who kept the charge of the LORD’s tabernacle, as the LORD commanded Moses.
verses.comment: Levites’ share provided as God commanded.

verses.text: Then the officers who were over the thousands of the army, the commanders of thousands and the commanders of hundreds, approached Moses
verses.comment: The commanders report on the outcome.

verses.text: and said to Moses, “Your servants have counted the men of war who are under our command, and not one man among us is missing.
verses.comment: Miraculous—no Israelite losses.

verses.text: And we have brought the LORD’s offering, what each man found, articles of gold: armlets, bracelets, signet rings, earrings, and pendants, to make atonement for ourselves before the LORD.”
verses.comment: Personal freewill offering in thanks for their safety.

verses.text: And Moses and Eleazar the priest received from them the gold, all crafted articles.
verses.comment: Moses and Eleazar accept the gifts.

verses.text: All the gold of the contribution that they presented to the LORD, from the commanders of thousands and the commanders of hundreds, was 16,750 shekels.
verses.comment: Weight of tribute to the LORD.

verses.text: The men of war had each taken plunder for themselves.
verses.comment: Each soldier received personal rewards.

verses.text: Moses and Eleazar the priest received the gold from the commanders of thousands and of hundreds, and brought it into the tent of meeting as a memorial for the people of Israel before the LORD.
verses.comment: The memorial offering is kept before the LORD to remember this event.
